summary.p: The Upatēcakāṇṭam is the seventh Kāṇṭam of the Kantapurāṇam, written by Kōṉēriyappar (15th century?) as a supplement to the the Kantapurāṇam of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār. There is another version by Ñāṉavarōtayar (15th century?).
The text is complete. There is no text discontinuity between U3a, f73v and f104r, only a foliation discontinuity. The total stanzas is 4333 (U3b, f273r8).
The additional Title Page was placed outside the bundle, on the front cover, at the time of examination.

Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, invocation page, marginal title, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statements, in-text intermediate total stanzas, text total stanzas, colophon, notes (calculations?).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (November 2019 and January 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

filiation.p: GOML D. 538–539 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, pp. 517–518.); TMSSML cat. n° 451ff. (see Olaganatha Pillay 1925, pp. 361ff.).

collation.desc: 1 folio = Upatēcakāṇṭam: Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank. Shelfmark. Hand #1.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Used as notebook by later hands: notes (calculations?) by later hands. Tamil numerals arranged in a table of the recto. Series of Tamil numerals on the verso.
244 folios = Upatēcakāṇṭam. Tamil foliation {1}, 2–73 (f1 not explicitly foliated) and 104-273. Hand #2. 8 to 9 lines per page.
243 folios = Upatēcakāṇṭam: Text. Tamil foliation 2–73 and 104-273.

supportDesc.condition: Palm-leaf. Relatively good state of preservation, in spite of many bore holes caused by insects and truncated leaves.

additions.desc: Round shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 445 crossed-out in red by a later hand (f[1]r).

Round shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written313 (in red; crossed-out in blue by a later hand) & 337 (in blue) (f[1]r). Not sticking any more, not covered by Gallica photos. Right of the other round shelfmark sticker.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year tuṉmuki of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1836-1837, 1776-1777, 1716-1717, etc. See colophon (U3b, f273r-f273v). The exact date cannot be ascertained since at least one of its calendrical elements is wrong. Possible (and plausible, since the manuscript was part of Ariel's bequest made to the Société Asiatique in 1855) conversions in the Gregorian are: 1656, 1716, 1776 and 1836. The appearance of the manuscript makes 1716 and 1776 the most plausible dates. For further details, see Ciotti & Franceschini (forthcoming). Dated to August 12, 1732 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1732 by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
